data.title: Bureau Of Cannabis Control Announces Grant Solicitation For Cannabis Equity Grants Program
data.author: Department of Cannabis Control
data.excerpt: The Bureau of Cannabis Control, in partnership with the Governor’s Office of Business and Economic Development, is pleased to announce that the fiscal year 2020-2021 Grant Solicitation for the Cannabis Equity Grants Program for Local Jurisdictions is now available.

content.rendered:
Sacramento, CA – The Bureau of Cannabis Control, in partnership with the Governor’s Office of Business and Economic Development (GO-Biz), is pleased to announce that the fiscal year 2020-2021 Grant Solicitation for the Cannabis Equity Grants Program for Local Jurisdictions is now available. The Grant Solicitation, link to the Online Application Portal, an Application User Guide, and required documents can be found at www.business.ca.gov/CEG.

Only eligible local jurisdictions may apply for this grant. Please review the Grant Solicitation prior to starting the online grant application. Applications must be submitted via the online application portal by February 1, 2021, at 11:59 pm.

In accordance with the California Cannabis Equity Act as amended by AB 97 (Stats. 2019, Ch. 40), the Bureau of Cannabis Control entered into an interagency agreement with GO-Biz to administer the Cannabis Equity Grants Program for Local Jurisdictions to aid local equity program efforts to support equity applicants and equity licensees. Offering these grants to support equity programs furthers the state’s goal of reducing barriers to entry into the regulated cannabis industry.

For questions or technical assistance about the Cannabis Equity Grants program for Local Jurisdictions, email GO-Biz at CEG@gobiz.ca.gov or call (916) 322-2683.

To subscribe to email alerts to hear about updates as they become available, please visit the Bureau’s website at https://bcc.ca.gov/. For information on all three state cannabis licensing authorities, please visit the state’s California Cannabis Portal at https://cannabis.ca.gov/. Follow the Bureau on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for daily news and updates. Those looking to get in touch with the Bureau of Cannabis Control may contact us directly through email at bcc@dca.ca.gov.
